description: From French hachure (“crosshatching”), from hacher (“to hatch”).

entries.meaning: (cartography, chiefly historical) A line on a map indicating the steepness of a slope.

verbs.description: hachure (third-person singular simple present hachures, present participle hachuring, simple past and past participle hachured)

entries.meaning: To mark a map with hachures.
